alert.note: Alert for McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 4:43AM CDT until June 02 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Illinois, including the following counties, Hancock and McDonough. * WHEN...Until noon CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 AM CDT, Doppler radar was showing some additional moderate to heavy rain moving into the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macomb, Carthage, Bushnell, Colchester, Augusta, Bowen, Industry, Bardolph, West Point, Tennessee, Colmar, Fandon, Western Illinois University, Adair, New Philadelphia, Plymouth, Denver, Fountain Green, Basco and Bentley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
